info.title: MasterData
info.description:
The Master Data management API allows for an external system to create, retrieve, update or delete TruckMate configuration data, such as Client, Vendor and Driver profiles, as well as sites, zones, commodity codes etc.

[Download latest released OpenAPI](https://truckmatecloudhub.trimble-transportation.com/masterData/openapi.json "download")


 This documentation is based on the most currently released version of TruckMate. Documentation for previous versions can be accessed by navigating to the openapi.json endpoint for any given API (the service must be set up and running). For example: http://DOMAIN/openapi.json



---

tags.name: Accessorial Charge Codes
tags.description: Retrieves, creates, updates and deletes TruckMate accessorial charge codes. Accessorial charge codes can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Codes Maintenance application.

tags.name: Clients
tags.description: Retrieves, creates, updates and deletes TruckMate client profiles. Client profiles can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Customer & Vendor Profiles application.

tags.name: Commodities
tags.description: Retrieves, creates, updates and deletes TruckMate commodity codes. Commodity codes can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Codes Maintenance application.

tags.name: Drivers
tags.description: Retrieves, creates, updates and deletes TruckMate driver profiles. Driver profiles can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Driver Profiles application.

tags.name: Eligible Carriers
tags.description: Retrieves TruckMate eligible carriers based on a provided order interliner identifier and list of carrier identifiers to verify. Carriers can be viewed in the Customer & Vendor profiles application > Vendor tab.

tags.name: Login
tags.description: The login authentication endpoints are used to generate a JWT (JSON Web Token) to be used as the authorization bearer token for subsequent API calls. Web users and their login credentials are configured either through the Profiles > TruckMate Customer and Vendor Profiles application  > TM4Web Configuration tab. TM4Web Access Group configuration options are setup in the TruckMate for Web > Web Admin application.

tags.name: Service Levels
tags.description: Retrieves TruckMate service level codes. Service level codes can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Codes Maintenance application.

tags.name: Status Codes
tags.description: Retrieves TruckMate status codes. Status codes can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Codes Maintenance application.

tags.name: Trace Types
tags.description: Retrieves TruckMate trace number type codes. Trace number type codes can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Codes Maintenance application.

tags.name: Trailers
tags.description: Retrieves TruckMate trailer profiles and trailer special events. Trailer profiles can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Trailer Profiles application.

tags.name: Un Numbers
tags.description: Retrieves TruckMate UN numbers. UN numbers can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Codes Maintenance application.

tags.name: Units
tags.description: Retrieves TruckMate units of measurement. Units can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Codes Maintenance application.

tags.name: Vendors
tags.description: Retrieves, creates, updates and deletes TruckMate vendor profiles. Vendor profiles can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Customer & Vendor Profiles application.

tags.name: Version
tags.description: The version endpoint allows the ART server version information to be retrieved. This will include the version number of the TruckMate ART Server (Windows Service) application.

tags.name: Whoami
tags.description: Retrieves identity of the user associated with the provided authorization method.

tags.name: Zones
tags.description: Retrieves, creates, updates and deletes TruckMate zone codes. Zone codes can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Codes Maintenance application.

get.description:
Retrieves accessorial charge code records that can be used to create charges for a freight bill or a trip.

Accessorial charge codes can be viewed in the Codes Maintenance application > Accessorial Charges tab.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

post.description:
Creates one or more accessorial charge code records including both header and detail portions, as well as the following assignment criteria:

- Extra stop rates

- Customer account assignments (detail level)

- Rate sheet assignments

- Service level assignments

- Vendor account assignments (detail level)

- Freight bill type restrictions

- Valuation charges

The customSQL will be added to the WHERE clause of the following SQL statement:

	SELECT COUNT(*) FROM TLORDER WHERE DETAIL_LINE_ID = (SELECT DETAIL_LINE_ID FROM TLORDER FETCH FIRST ROW ONLY) 
	AND

Accessorial charge codes can be viewed in the Codes Maintenance application > Accessorial Charges tab.

requestBody.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the Accessorial Charges to be created.

Retrieves an accessorial charge code record.

Accessorial charge codes can be viewed in the Codes Maintenance application > Accessorial Charges tab.

parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

put.description:
Updates one or more properties of a specific accessorial charge code record including both header and detail portions, as well as the following assignment criteria:

- Extra stop rates

- Customer account assignments (detail level)

- Rate sheet assignments

- Service level assignments

- Vendor account assignments (detail level)

- Freight bill type restrictions

- Valuation charges

The customSQL will be added to the WHERE clause of the following SQL statement:

	SELECT COUNT(*) FROM TLORDER WHERE DETAIL_LINE_ID = (SELECT DETAIL_LINE_ID FROM TLORDER FETCH FIRST ROW ONLY) 
	AND

Accessorial charge codes can be viewed in the Codes Maintenance application > Accessorial Charges tab.

requestBody.description: A JSON objects containing the properties of the Accessorial Charges to be updated.

delete.description:
Deletes an accessorial charge code record.

Accessorial charge code records which have been assigned to a freight bill or trip cannot be deleted.

Accessorial charge codes can be viewed in the Codes Maintenance application > Accessorial Charges tab.

get.description:
Retrieves accessorial charge code valuation records for the specified accessorial charge code.

Accessorial charge code valuations can be viewed in the Codes Maintenance application > Accessorial Charges tab for Charge Behavior = Valuation.

post.summary: Add an accessorial charge code valuation
post.description:
Adds one or more accessorial charge code valuation records to the specified accessorial charge code.

The accessorial charge code must be active and valid with the following settings on the Codes Maintenance application > Accessorial Charges tab:

- Accessorial charge code Charge Behavior = 'Valuation'

- Valuation charge code Calc Order is NOT '0'

- Valuation charge code Calc Order is smaller than the accessorial charge code Calc Order

Accessorial charge code valuations can be viewed in the Codes Maintenance application > Accessorial Charges tab for Charge Behavior = Valuation.

requestBody.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the valuation record to be created.

parameters.name: onlyPostedResults
parameters.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the custom defined field to be created

delete.description:

Accessorial charge code valuations can be viewed in the Codes Maintenance application > Accessorial Charges tab for Charge Behavior = Valuation.

get.description:
Retrieves client records.

 As of TruckMate 25.2, the apptReq and spotTrailer are no longer returning True/False values. Please

 refer to the openAPI request and response body schema for supported field values.

 Client profiles can be viewed in the Customer & Vendor Profiles application > Customer tab.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

post.description:
Creates one or more client records.

If the clientId is included in the Request body, it will be used. If the clientId is not included, it can be auto generated based on the following app config option.

- PROFILE.EXE > Auto Gen Client key

Client profiles can be viewed in the Customer & Vendor Profiles application > Customer tab.

App config options can be viewed in the Application Configurator application.

requestBody.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the client to be created.

get.description:
Retrieves a client record.

 As of TruckMate 25.2, the apptReq and spotTrailer are no longer returning True/False values. Please

 refer to the openAPI request and response body schema for supported field values.

 Client profiles can be viewed in the Customer & Vendor Profiles application > Customer tab.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

put.description:
Updates one or more properties of a specific client record.

Client profiles can be viewed in the Customer & Vendor Profiles application > Customer tab.

The requested body may include child resources such as details, dangerousGoods, customDefs, etc. Keep in mind when a resource is specified in the body, it will do a complete replace of that resource. In other words, it will DELETE ALL records of the specified resource in the order, and insert new ones from the request body.

To update an individual child record use the PUT method directly against the child resource record itself.

For example, to update an individual detail line use PUT /orders/{orderId}/details/{orderDetailId}

requestBody.description: A JSON objects containing the properties of the client to be updated.

delete.description:
Deletes a specific client record.

Client profiles can be viewed in the Customer & Vendor Profiles application > Customer tab.

get.description:
Retrieves client accessorial charges substitution records for the specified client.

Client accessorial charges substitutions can be viewed in the Customer & Vendor Profiles application > Customer > Rating > Extra Charges tab > Substitution Code column.

post.summary: Add a client accessorial charges substitution
post.description:
Adds one or more client accessorial charges substitution records to the specified client.

Creating a substitution record is different from the normal process. Instead of creating a new record, you must change one of the Auto-Assign, Substitution Code or Substitution Order values on an existing record in the Customer Profiles > Rating > Extra Charges tab grid. This will create a substitution record.

Accessorial charge codes can be selected as a substitution code only if they satisfy both criteria:

* The 'Custom Code Only' checkbox is selected (in Codes Maintenance > Accessorial Charges tab).

* They have the same charge behavior as the charge code they are replacing.

If Auto-Assign is not included in the request, it will default to the âAuto-Assign by Defaultâ checkbox setting for the base accessorial charge code as defined in Codes Maintenance.

If you set the substitution code to be blank, it will assigned a value of '(Disallowed)' to prevent this accessorial charge from being used for this client.

Client accessorial charges substitutions can be viewed in the Customer & Vendor Profiles application > Customer > Rating > Extra Charges tab > Substitution Code column.

requestBody.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the accessorial substitute code to be created.

parameters.name: onlyPostedResults
parameters.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the custom defined field to be created

delete.description:
Deletes client accessorial charges substitution records from the specified client.

Client accessorial charges substitutions can be viewed in the Customer & Vendor Profiles application > Customer > Rating > Extra Charges tab > Substitution Code column.

get.summary: Retrieve a client accessorial charges substitution
get.description:
Retrieves a client accessorial charges substitution record for the specified client.

Client accessorial charges substitutions can be viewed in the Customer & Vendor Profiles application > Customer > Rating > Extra Charges tab > Substitution Code column.

put.summary: Update a client accessorial charges substitution
put.description:
Updates a client accessorial charges substitution record for the specified client.

Accessorial charge codes can be selected as a substitution code only if they satisfy both criteria:

* The 'Custom Code Only' checkbox is selected (in Codes Maintenance > Accessorial Charges tab).
